data.name: Doc_HTML
data.value:
Holiday Labels and Lists

Holiday Labels and Lists User Documentation

Introduction

The Holiday Labels and Lists program("HLL") is meant to be used in connection with Valley's holiday programs. It streamlines the process of creating bag and gift labels, master and donor lists, participant lists, participant summary labels, and postcard labels from VESTA reports.

The focus of HLL's display is the "Available Label and List Files" window. The items listed there are HLL's "work product;" its reason for being.

Other items in the program's window are:

  • Controls used to select which of the available label and list files to view. You can filter the view by file type (participant list, bag labels, etc.), year, and donor, and also select whether or not to view backup files.
  • Buttons to:
    • Import data from VESTA reports
    • Generate label and list files from the imported data
    • Delete old label and list files in order to free up disk space
    • View this help file
    • Exit the program

NOTE: HLL does not create the VESTA reports; instead, it uses reports which have already been downloaded from VESTA. Also, HLL does not delete the VESTA reports, or change them in any way -- after you have imported their data, they will remain wherever you left them. You can even add them again if you want.

How to Use

Before using HLL, log in to VESTA and download one or more reports. Make sure to save them as Excel files, and remember where you save them. Then, start HLL, click "ProcessVESTA Reports." A standard Windows file selection dialog will open, allowing you to go to the folder containing your VESTA reports and select those reports (either one at a time or multiple files at once). HLL will then read the reports and save their data internally. Note that this does NOT generate the label and list documents you're interested in.

Once the VESTA reports have been processed, click "Create Labels and Lists." This will use the data saved in the previous step to generate all applicable label and list files. The generated files will show up in HLL under "Available Label and List Files." Double-click on a file and it will open up in Excel or Word as appropriate, for viewing or printing.

When you create label and list files, if the name of an output label or list file matches a file that already exists, the older file will be renamed. For example, if "Bag_Labels_2016_Clothing_XYZ.docx" is already there, the original will be renamed "Bag_Labels_2016_Clothing_XYZ.bak0001.docx," "Bag_Labels_2016_Clothing_XYZ.bak0002.docx," and so on.

After some time, it's possible that HLL will have created many label and list documents which are no longer required. In order to free disk space or reduce clutter, HLL allows you to get rid of some of these by clicking the "Delete Files from Previous Years" button. Note that this functionality will not delete any participant lists, no matter how old, and will not delete any files from the two most recent years.

Where Are My Files?

HLL puts the files it generates into subfolders under the ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT FOLDER##. Files are sorted by year and by type. For example, for program year 2017, the files will be located as follows:

  • Bag and Gift Labels: ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Christmas
  • Donor and Master Lists: ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Christmas
  • Participant Lists and Postcard Labels:
    • Adopt a Family: ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Christmas
    • Holiday Food Basket:_##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Christmas
    • Thanksgiving Basket: ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Thanksgiving
  • Anything else (eg Fans/Heaters): ##TOPLEVEL_OUTPUT_FOLDER##\2017\Other

Backup files will be placed in the same folders as the files they're backing up.

There is no provision in HLL to delete anything other than old files (files older than the most recent two years). To delete anything else, go to the storagefolder via Windows Explorer and manually delete the files.

Usage Tips

  • Instead of using many small VESTA reports, use a few larger ones. When you ask VESTA for the reports, you have the option of asking for reports for only a single donor and only a single report type (e.g., a Gift Label Report for Mike Albert Leasing). Instead of doing that, ask for a report for Toys and Clothing labels, both Gift and Bag, for all donors at once. Then tell HLL to process that one big file. It will take a while (maybe several minutes) but is a much better use of your time than processing dozens of smaller reports individually!

Problems? Suggestions? Further Questions?

I only see files for one donor!

Use the Donor "drop-down" selecter to pick another donor. If the donor you're looking for isn't there, verify that you've processed VESTA reports pertaining to that donor. If you're unsure whether you've processed a particular VESTA report, click "Process VESTA Reports" to import that VESTA report's data. Once you've done that, be sure to click "Create Labels and Lists" to generate output files from the new data.

(HLL does not have a "display files for all donors" option -- that would probably not be very comfortable to use because of the clutter.)

I don't see bag/gift/donor/master files for a donor!

It may be that that particular donor is not participating in that particular program.

Some or all of the participant summary labels are missing!

Participant summary labels are generated using data from both VESTA partnership enrollment reports and VESTA label reports (specifically, VESTA gift label reports). If you have imported data for a given year from VESTA gift label reports, but not the corresponding partnership enrollment reports, then HLL cannot generate those participant summaries.

Use the "Process VESTA Reports" button to import all the data relevant to the label and list documents you need, and then click "Create Labels and Lists."


I have a suggestion for how to improve HLL, or I have another question or problem not address in this document.

The administrator of ##PROGEAM_NAME## is ##ADMIN_NAME##. You can email him at
